text: Using Python class as a data container
Sometimes it makes sense to cluster related data together.
I tend to do so with a dict, e.g.,

code:
self.group = dict(a=1, b=2, c=3)
print self.group[a]

text: One of my colleagues prefers to create a class

code:
class groupClass(object):
    def __init__(a, b, c):
        self.a = a
        self.b = b
        self.c = c
self.group = groupClass(1, 2, 3)
print self.group.a

text: Note that we are not defining any class methods.
I like to use a dict because I like to minimize the number of lines of code.
My colleague thinks the code is more readable if you use a class, and it makes it easier to add methods to the class in the future.
Which do you prefer and why?
